Items.Title: Resolution authorizing the Speaker to file or join amicus briefs on behalf of the Council in the litigation captioned Windsor v. United States, currently on appeal in the United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit, for the purpose of supporting the plaintiff’s position that section 3 of the Defense of Marriage Act, which defines the terms “marriage” and “spouse” under federal law to mean only heterosexual unions and individuals, is unconstitutional.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Civil Rights
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, The President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) declared the Resolution to be adopted.



The following Council Member formally voted against this item:  Council Member Greenfield.



The following 6 Council Members formally abstained to vote on this item:  Council Members Halloran, Ignizio, Sanders, Ulrich, Vallone, Jr., and Oddo.



Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Supporting the plaintiff’s position that section 3 of the Defense of Marriage Act.
